Class GameEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameEnvironment

  • public class GameEnvironment
extends java.lang.Object
    GameEnvironment objects are used by Game objects to play through the game. These objects control all logic related to the game.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static HealingItem[] ALL_HEALING_ITEMS
      An array of instances of all the HealingItem subclasses.
      static PowerUp[] ALL_POWER_UPS
      An array of instances of all the PowerUp subclasses.
      private java.util.ArrayList<City> cities
      An list of the cities to be played in the game.
      private int currentCityIndex
      The index of the city currently being played in the list of cities.
      private int numberOfCities
      The number of cities the team need to play through in order to complete the game.
      private int PRIZE_MONEY
      The amount of money the team is given when they defeat a villain.
      private double RANDOM_EVENT_PROBABILITY
      The probability as a decimal that a random event will occur each time the team returns to the home base.
      private java.time.LocalTime startTime
      The start time of the game, as a LocalTime object.
      private Team team
      The team of heroes playing the game.

    • Field Detail

      • ALL_POWER_UPS

        public static final PowerUp[] ALL_POWER_UPS
        An array of instances of all the PowerUp subclasses.

      • ALL_HEALING_ITEMS

        public static final HealingItem[] ALL_HEALING_ITEMS
        An array of instances of all the HealingItem subclasses.

      • PRIZE_MONEY

        private final int PRIZE_MONEY
        The amount of money the team is given when they defeat a villain.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RANDOM_EVENT_PROBABILITY

        private final double RANDOM_EVENT_PROBABILITY
        The probability as a decimal that a random event will occur each time the team returns to the home base.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • team

        private Team team
        The team of heroes playing the game.

      • startTime

        private java.time.LocalTime startTime
        The start time of the game, as a LocalTime object. Used to calculate the time taken to finish the game.

      • numberOfCities

        private int numberOfCities
        The number of cities the team need to play through in order to complete the game. User is asked to choose the number of cities before the game is created. Can be between 3 and 6.

      • cities

        private java.util.ArrayList<City> cities
        An list of the cities to be played in the game. The length of the list should be equal to numberOfCities. The villain in each city is randomised, and the last city contains the super villain.

      • currentCityIndex

        private int currentCityIndex
        The index of the city currently being played in the list of cities.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameEnvironment

        public GameEnvironment(java.lang.String teamName,
                       int numberOfHeroes,
                       int numberOfCities)
        Creates a new game. Creates a team with the given team name, and sets startNumHeroes of team to the given number of heroes, but doesn't add any heroes to the team. Initialises the list of cities and sets currentCityIndex to 0.
        Parameters:
        teamName - The name of the team to be created.
        numberOfHeroes - The number of heroes to be added to the team.
        numberOfCities - The number of cities the team needs to play through to complete the game.

    • Method Detail

      • initialiseCities

        private void initialiseCities()
        Initialises the list of cities to be played through in the game. The length of the list is equal to numberOfCities. The villain in each city is randomised, with the last city containing the super villain.

      • enterFirstCity

        public void enterFirstCity()
        Sets currentCityIndex to 0, and sets all the sectors of the first city to discovered if the team has a hero with the map special ability.

      • nextCity

        public void nextCity()
        Increments the currentCityIndex, and sets all sectors in the new city to discovered if the team has a hero with the map specialAbility. Throws a RuntimeException if currentCityIndex exceeds numerOfCities.

      • healHeroes

        public void healHeroes()
        Any healing items currently applied to heroes on the team are updated, increasing the hero's health if needed.

      • randomEvent

        public java.lang.String randomEvent()
        Implements the possibility of a random event occurring to the team. The probability that a random event occurs each time the team enters the home base is given by RANDOM_EVENT_PROBABILITY. A random event can be: - the team loses a random item from their inventory (team gets robbed). - the team is gifted a random item to their inventory. The two types of random event occur with equal probability.
        Returns:
        A string description of the random event that has occurred, or null if no event occurred.

      • giftTeam

        private java.lang.String giftTeam()
        Adds a random power up or healing item to the team's inventory.
        Returns:
        A string description of the random event that has occurred.

      • robTeam

        private java.lang.String robTeam()
        Removes a random power up or healing item from the team. If the team doesn't own any power ups or healing items, there is no change.
        Returns:
        A string description of the random event that has occurred.

      • processMiniGameResult

        public void processMiniGameResult(boolean hasWon,
                                  Hero hero,
                                  Villain villain)
        Takes the result of a completed mini game, and processes the result. If the hero won, does damage to the villain, checking whether the hero does double damage. If the villain has been defeated three times, rewards the team with coins. If the hero lost, the hero takes the appropriate amount of damage.
        Parameters:
        hasWon - Whether or not the hero won the mini game.
        hero - The hero who was playing the mini game.
        villain - The villain who was playing the mini game.

      • getTeam

        public Team getTeam()
        Getter method for team.
        Returns:
        The value of team.

      • getCurrentCityIndex

        public int getCurrentCityIndex()
        Getter method for currentCityIndex.
        Returns:
        The value of currentCityIndex.

      • currentCity

        public City currentCity()
        Returns the current city being played.
        Returns:
        The current city.

      • getPrizeMoney

        public int getPrizeMoney()
        Getter method for PRIZE_MONEY.
        Returns:
        the value of PRIZE_MONEY.

      • getStartTime

        public java.time.LocalTime getStartTime()
        Getter method for startTime.
        Returns:
        The value of startTime.
